item.title: You’ve got a large tree that has uprooted and lifted the surrounding paving, leaving exposed roots, unstable ground, and displaced bricks. It is positioned directly next to a drain cover and adjacent to the public highway. The area has been temporarily taped off, but the tree and damaged paving remain in place months after being reported., 12th February
item.description:
Dear Bexley Council Team, Thank you for your response. We acknowledge your position that the land may not be owned by the London Borough of Bexley. However, despite attempting to identify and contact the relevant private landowner, no party has accepted responsibility for this matter. In the meantime, the hazard remains unresolved. As previously outlined and shown in the attached photographs, the tree has uprooted, significantly lifted the surrounding paving, and is positioned directly adjacent to a drain cover. The structural damage to the paving and the instability of the root plate present a clear and ongoing safety risk. The proximity to drainage infrastructure further increases concern regarding potential underground damage. This area is immediately accessible from the public highway and is located outside a children’s residential home. The current tape barrier is not a sufficient long-term control measure. Given that the Council has already undertaken emergency works in recognition of the tree being dangerous, we respectfully request clarification on the following: • Whether Highways or another relevant department can conduct a joint inspection due to the hazard’s proximity to the public highway and drainage system • Whether the Council can formally identify and notify the responsible landowner • What interim safety measures can be implemented to prevent injury while ownership is being established The risk remains active and unresolved. We would appreciate clear guidance and confirmation of next steps as a matter of urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watersmeet Way, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
